title: Capture user goal at start of chat
description: When a user starts a Wyshbone UI chat, capture their high-level goal (e.g. 'I want 50 new pubs in Yorkshire that rotate guest ales') and store it in session context so Supervisor and tools can use it.
replitPrompt: You are my coding assistant for the Wyshbone UI repl. Add a small module and integration so that when a new chat session starts, the UI asks the user for their high-level sales/lead goal in natural language (if one is not already known). Store this goal in persistent session state (e.g. per-user context) and make it available to the tool-calling layer so tools like lead search and monitoring can see it. Do not hardcode any specific industries; treat it as free text. After implementation, expose a helper function like `getUserGoal(sessionId)` we can call from elsewhere.

title: Clarifying question step before running tools
description: Before Wyshbone UI runs any heavy tool calls (lead search, monitoring, outreach), it should ask 1–3 clarifying questions if the goal or parameters are underspecified, instead of jumping straight to actions.
replitPrompt: You are my coding assistant for the Wyshbone UI repl. Modify the tool-calling logic so that when the user asks for something that will trigger tools (lead search, monitoring, outreach), the chat first checks whether it has enough information: target region, target persona, volume and timing. If these are missing or ambiguous, ask up to 3 clarifying questions to fill the gaps before calling any tools. Keep questions short and practical for salespeople. Once clarified, proceed to call tools with the enriched parameters.

title: Lead generation plan object (Agentic v1 core)
description: Supervisor should be able to turn a user goal + context (industry, region, volume) into a structured LeadGenPlan describing which tools to run, in what order, and with what parameters.
replitPrompt: You are my coding assistant for the Wyshbone Supervisor repl. Create a LeadGenPlan representation (TypeScript type or interface) and a function like `planLeadGeneration(goal, context)` that returns a plan: steps with tool identifiers (e.g. GOOGLE_PLACES_SEARCH, HUNTER_ENRICH, EMAIL_SEQUENCE_SETUP), parameters, and dependencies. This is planning only: do not execute tools here. We will later have an executor that reads this plan and runs the tools.

title: LeadGen plan executor
description: Given a LeadGenPlan, Supervisor should be able to execute the steps one by one, handle errors, and write progress updates back to the user via Wyshbone UI or email.
replitPrompt: You are my coding assistant for the Wyshbone Supervisor repl. Implement a LeadGenPlan executor function like `executeLeadGenerationPlan(plan, user)` that runs the tools defined in the plan in order, passing the right parameters, handling failures with retries where sensible, and logging structured progress events. Do not design new tools here; assume existing ones like global lead search, enrichment, and outreach. Make it easy to plug in new tools later by routing through a single tool-execution layer.

title: Background monitor for user goals
description: Supervisor periodically wakes up, looks at active user goals, and decides whether to suggest new segments, new experiments, or new monitors to the user based on past performance.
replitPrompt: You are my coding assistant for the Wyshbone Supervisor repl. Add a lightweight background monitor job that, on a schedule, iterates over active user goals / lead-generation projects and evaluates simple performance metrics (e.g. leads found, emails sent). Based on thresholds, generate suggestions like 'try this new region', 'try targeting bottle shops as well as pubs', or 'increase or decrease volume'. For now, log these suggestions and expose them via an internal API; later we will wire them into UI and email.

title: Persist status snapshots for history
description: Store a rolling history of status snapshots (cleverness, LOC, TODO/FIXME) to disk so we can see trends over time, not just the latest view.
replitPrompt: You are my coding assistant for the WyshbonePoller repl. Extend the poller so that each polling cycle appends a compact snapshot (timestamp, app name, clevernessIndex, LOC, TODO, FIXME) to a local JSONL file under data/status_history.jsonl, keeping disk usage reasonable (e.g. truncate older than N days or keep last N records per app). This is purely for historical analysis and graphs later.

title: My Goals panel
description: Display a dedicated panel showing all active user goals with their current status, progress, and quick actions.

title: Pause/resume goals
description: Allow users to pause and resume active goals, preventing automated actions while preserving context.

title: Clone/adjust goals
description: Enable users to clone existing goals and adjust parameters like region, volume, or target persona.

title: Goal templates (pubs, bottle shops, coffee shops)
description: Provide pre-built goal templates for common verticals to help users get started quickly.

title: Progress summary widget
description: Show a compact summary of goal progress including leads found, emails sent, and success rate.

title: Natural-language progress updates
description: Display progress updates in plain English rather than raw metrics (e.g., 'Found 23 new pubs in Yorkshire today').

title: Traffic-light goal status
description: Show green/amber/red status indicators for goals based on their performance and health.

title: User approval of plan
description: Before executing a plan, show it to the user and require explicit approval.

title: Edit plan steps
description: Allow users to modify, reorder, or remove steps in a proposed plan before execution.

title: Override segments and target persona
description: Enable users to manually override automatically detected segments and personas in plans.

title: Plan branches by budget/volume constraints
description: Generate different plan variations based on user budget and volume constraints.

title: Fallback data sources in plan generation
description: When primary data sources fail, automatically use fallback sources during plan generation.

title: Use historical performance in planning
description: Incorporate past goal performance data to inform future plan generation and tool selection.

title: Retry logic with exponential backoff
description: Implement intelligent retry logic for failed tool calls with exponential backoff.

title: Reorder plan steps dynamically
description: Dynamically reorder plan execution steps based on runtime conditions and dependencies.

title: Partial-success handling
description: Handle partial successes gracefully, proceeding with available data rather than failing completely.

title: Decision points asking user for guidance
description: Pause execution at decision points to ask the user for guidance when confidence is low.

title: Suggestions injected into the chat during execution
description: Send real-time suggestions to the UI chat during plan execution when opportunities are detected.

title: Display Supervisor suggestions inline
description: Show Supervisor suggestions inline in the chat interface as they arrive.

title: Execution timeline view
description: Display a visual timeline of plan execution showing completed, in-progress, and upcoming steps.

title: Error explanation view (what happened and why)
description: When errors occur, show user-friendly explanations of what went wrong and why.

title: Success metrics per goal
description: Track and store success metrics (conversion rates, lead quality) for each active goal.

title: Per-goal success score
description: Calculate and track a composite success score for each goal based on multiple metrics.

title: Weekly goal review summary
description: Generate weekly summaries of goal performance and send them to users via email or UI.

title: Cleverness trend graph
description: Display historical trends of cleverness index across all monitored apps.

title: Complexity vs TODO/FIXME trend
description: Track the relationship between code complexity (LOC) and technical debt (TODO/FIXME) over time.

title: Tool error rate charts
description: Monitor and visualize error rates for each tool used in lead generation.

title: Error spike alerting
description: Detect and alert when error rates spike above normal thresholds.

title: Goal stagnation alerting
description: Alert when goals show no progress for extended periods.

title: System status dashboard (Green/Amber/Red)
description: Overall system health dashboard with traffic-light status indicators.

title: Show system health inside chat when something is wrong
description: Display system health warnings in the chat interface when problems are detected.

title: Define Experiment object
description: Create data structure for tracking experiments including hypothesis, variants, and success metrics.

title: Supervisor proposes experiments
description: Automatically propose A/B experiments based on goal performance patterns.

title: Auto-run experiments in safe mode
description: Automatically execute low-risk experiments without user approval in safe mode.

title: Poller auto-creates tasks when TODO spikes
description: Automatically create cleanup tasks when TODO/FIXME counts spike significantly.

title: Supervisor auto-creates tasks when tools underperform
description: Automatically create investigation tasks when tool performance degrades.

title: Task ranking by impact/effort
description: Automatically rank tasks based on estimated impact and effort using historical data.

title: Learn from experiment outcomes
description: Update planning logic based on experiment results to improve future performance.

title: Build vertical-specific Playbooks
description: Create and maintain vertical-specific playbooks (pubs, bottle shops, etc.) based on successful patterns.

title: Show Playbook suggestions to user
description: Display relevant playbook suggestions to users when starting new goals.

title: Global knowledge base of patterns
description: Build a cross-user knowledge base of successful lead generation patterns.

title: Cross-user anonymised performance data
description: Collect and analyze anonymized performance data across all users to identify global patterns.

title: Global strategy updates pushed to users
description: Push proven strategies from global learning back to individual user instances.

title: Cross-vertical pattern transfer system
description: Identify patterns that work across verticals and transfer them intelligently.

title: Per-user opt-in/out for global learning
description: Allow users to control whether they participate in global learning and receive global updates.
